intro: Oncidium falcipetalum, commonly known as the golden orchid, is a species of orchid native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its pendulous, showy inflorescences that bear clusters of fragrant, yellowish-orange flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in tropical rainforests. Its leaves are broad and革质, providing a sturdy structure for supporting its floral display. Oncidium falcipetalum is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and relatively easy care requirements.
